articles.author: Vladimir Hedrih
articles.title: Maltreated children tend to have lower brain volumes - PsyPost
articles.description: Toddlers who experienced severe abuse had reduced brain volumes, which was associated with lower cognitive abilities, according to research published in Neurobiology of Stress.
articles.content: A neuroimaging study of toddlers exposed to physical or emotional abuse within the past 6 months reported that children who suffered more severe maltreatment tended to have lower total brain volume. … [+4627 chars]
